thread.title: CW's 'Crazy Ex-Girlfriend' opens to small audience
thread.title_full: CW's 'Crazy Ex-Girlfriend' opens to small audience

title: CW's 'Crazy Ex-Girlfriend' opens to small audience
text:
Rachel Bloom rehearses one of her original song-and-dance numbers for CW's 'Crazy Ex-Girlfriend.' (Photo: Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY)
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE CW's Crazy Ex-Girlfriend got off to a slow ratings start Monday, averaging 928,000 viewers. The second-season premiere of Jane the Virgin , which followed, attracted 1.1 million.
Both critically praised shows fell short of Jane 's 2014 premiere, which drew 1.6 million viewers with the help of an Originals lead-in.
Crazy , arguably the new broadcast series with the most positive reviews, led off the night and drew a young-adult audience half the size of the one Jane garnered for its sereis premiere last year.
The dark musical comedy, which features Internet star Rachel Bloom and creative song-and-dance numbers, will get a boost in audience as viewers increasingly watch shows on a delayed basis.
